business.headline: HDB Financial opens today: Should you subscribe to the biggest IPO of 2025?HDB Financial IPO: The public listing consists of a fresh issue of 3.38 crore shares worth Rs 2,500 crore, and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of 13.51 crore shares, totalling Rs 10,000 crore.
Sensex, Nifty rally continues for second day as geopolitical fears subsideThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 442.13 points to 82,497.24, while the NSE Nifty50 added 127.10 points to 25,171.45 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to open higher? Check key trading levelsA fragile ceasefire between Iran and Israel has helped calm investor nerves and improve market sentiment across Asia and other major regions.

Stocks to watch on June 25: Infosys, Union Bank, RITES, Aurobindo PharmaMarkets saw a volatile session on Tuesday as they tracked the developments in the Middle East. The benchmark indices showed sharp ups and downs before closing with small gains.

Why middle-class Indians prefer Dubai to India for buying property, explains CAIn Dubai, many middle-class Indian couples have managed to purchase two to three properties by saving meticulously over the years. These properties, which offer rental yields of 6–7%, are financed at an interest rate of just 5%, creating sustainable assets that serve as both income sources and retirement plans.

Oman becomes first Gulf nation to introduce income tax from 2028The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has already hinted that other Gulf nations may eventually need to introduce income tax too, especially as global demand for fossil fuels continues to decline.

Sensex ends 158 points higher, Nifty settles above 25,000; Adani Ports down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 158.32 points to close at 82,055.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 72.45 points to end at 25,044.35.
Stock market down 1%: Why did Sensex, Nifty fall after early gains?The S&P BSE Sensex was up 261.25 points to 82,158.04, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 96.85 points to 25,068.75 as of 2:33 pm.

Labubu mania: How a quirky doll made Pop Mart a global giantAt the heart of this success is Pop Mart's 38-year-old founder Wang Ning, now one of China's top 10 richest people. As of June 2025, he's worth $22.7 billion, all thanks to Labubu.

Adani AGM 2025: Gautam Adani denies US bribery charges, asserts group's clean recordAhead of its AGM, Adani Airports Holdings Limited (AAHL) on Tuesday confirmed securing $1 billion in project finance for Mumbai International Airport Ltd (MIAL), which operates the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA).

Your CTC is lying to you: CA points out salary details most people overlookThe post is part caution and part financial literacy reminder. It challenges employees to take ownership of their earnings and not just celebrate the illusion of a big CTC.

Explained: Why are oil sector stocks rising today?The ceasefire announcement made by US President Donald Trump triggered a decline in oil prices, which had experienced a prior surge due to geopolitical tensions.

entertainment.headline: Mika Singh says desh pehle after calling Diljit Dosanjh fake amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowSinger and rapper Mika Singh lashed out at Diljit Dosanjh for collaborating with Pakistani actor Hania Aamir in 'Sardaar Ji 3' amid India-Pakistan conflict. He called him a 'fake singer'.

Diljit Dosanjh recalls crying over Met Gala look, sneaking kirpan to eventSinger-actor Diljit Dosanjh recently opened up about his Met Gala experience. He explained how Shakira helped him carry a 'kirpan' to the blue carpet.

Rajamouli debuts in Death Stranding 2 video game, excited fans call him global iconDirector SS Rajamouli and his son, SS Karthikeya, made cameo appearances in Hideo Kojima's Death Stranding 2: On the Beach. A clip featuring the two in the video game is going viral on social media.

Situation beyond control: Diljit Dosanjh on Sardaar Ji 3 row over Pak actorActor Diljit Dosanjh, in a recent interview, opened up about the ongoing controversy surrounding 'Sardaar Ji 3'. The actor and the makers are facing the heat over casting Pakistani actor Hania Aamir amid India-Pakistan tensions.

Diddy's team uses Cassie's 'loving' texts to counter accusationsSean "Diddy" Combs' defence rests after brief testimony in his sex trafficking trial. Closing arguments begin Thursday as jurors prepare to decide his fate; he faces up to life in prison if convicted.

Rajkummar Rao nervous to play Sourav Ganguly in biopic, says it's a huge responsibilityActor Rajkummar Rao opened up about playing Sourav Ganguly in his biopic on Tuesday. He said he is nervous about playing the role as it is a huge responsibility.

Raid 2 OTT release: When and where to watch Ajay Devgn's crime thrillerAjay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh's hit film 'Raid 2' is set to stream on Netflix from June 26, 2025. After earning over Rs 157 crore at the box office, the crime thriller now gears up for its digital debut.

And Just Like That's Cynthia Nixon, Kristin Davis on playing flawed women'And Just Like That' cast discusses the importance of flawed women on screen. The series highlights evolving roles and authentic representation in Indian and global contexts.

Jacqueline Fernandez honoured at Italian Global Series Festival 2025Jacqueline Fernandez received a special honour at the 2025 Italian Global Series Festival in Rimini for her remarkable contribution to cinema. She shared heartfelt moments from the event on Instagram, expressing gratitude for the international recognition.

Sana Khan's mother dies after health struggle, former actor shares emotional postSana Khan's mother, Saeeda Khan, died after a prolonged illness. The former actor shared the news on Instagram, asking fans to pray for her mother's soul.

BTS' Jimin joins Killin It Girl dance challenge. Watch viral videoBTS member Jimin posted a video of him dancing to fellow member JHope's 'Killin' It Girl' song. This is the first video the singer posted after getting discharged from the military on June 12.

Sonakshi on box office clash with Kajol: Proud our film releases alongside hersSonakshi Sinha expresses pride as her film 'Nikita Roy' releases alongside Kajol's 'Maa'. She welcomes the box office clash as a positive moment for both actresses.

Such hypocrisy: Uorfi Javed's sister Dolly slams Sufi Motiwala over abusive languageUorfi Javed's sister Dolly Javed stepped in to defend her sister over Sufi Motiwala's derogatory remarks on 'The Traitors'. Dolly questioned Sufi's hypocrisy for getting offended when people bullied him in the Prime Video reality show.

Ishaan Khatter's Europe trip with Shahid Kapoor ends. Pics scream bro goalsActor Ishaan Khatter on Tuesday shared photos from his Europe trip with actor-brother Shahid Kapoor on Instagram. Sharing the photos, the actor bid goodbye to Europe.

How Ginny & Georgia is a conversation starter on normalising therapy for parents'Ginny & Georgia' sets the premise to help Indian teenagers start tough conversations about mental health and therapy at home. The show encourages healing across generations by showing therapy as normal and necessary.
Shruti Haasan's X account hacked, actor alerts fansActor Shruti Haasan's X account got hacked earlier today. The actor warns fans of the cyberattack.

Kim Soo-hyun sues Kim Sae-ron's family over defamation caseActor Kim Soo-hyun has filed a criminal complaint against late actor Kim Sae-ron's family to clear his name and protect his reputation. This follows the late actor's ex-manager's defamation suit against another YouTuber.

Aamir Khan hosts special screening of Sitaare Zameen Par for President MurmuAamir Khan recently hosted a special screening of his sports-drama 'Sitaare Zameen Par' for President Droupadi Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhavan.

Arijit Singh surprises fans with virtual performance at Metro In Dino music launchSinger Arijit Singh couldn't attend the album launch of 'Metro In Dino' in Mumbai on Tuesday, but he managed to entertain his fans virtually. The singer gave a live virtual performance at the event.

general news.headline: Shubhanshu Shukla to launch into space today, India eyes historyThe mission is part of Axiom Space, a private aerospace company that plans to make space accessible and cheap and eventually build a private space station that would replace the ageing International Space Station.

US intel says Iran strikes only delayed nuke programme, Trump calls it fake newsA US intelligence report said airstrikes ordered by President Donald Trump did not fully destroy Iran's nuclear sites Fordow and Natanz, and only delayed the programme by a few months. However, Trump and the White House called out the report, labelling it as "fake news".

Placed democracy under arrest: PM's all-out attack on Congress on EmergencyOn the 50th anniversary of the Emergency, which the Centre has decided to observe as Samvidhan Hatya Diwas, PM Narendra Modi said no Indian would ever forget how the voice of Parliament was muzzled and attempts were made to control the courts.

Gambhir backs pacers despite Leeds disaster: Building a battery for futureIndia's head coach Gautam Gambhir has called for patience with the young bowling attack after a heavy defeat in Leeds. He stressed the need to back inexperienced pacers to build a strong pace battery for the future.

The fall of the iron fist: The end of Indira's EmergencyThe final part of the Democracy's Darkest Hour series charts the collapse of the Emergency, the surge in public resistance, and the lead-up to the 1977 general elections that brought India's authoritarian chapter to a close.

LIVE: India's Shubhanshu Shukla to drive to launch pad shortlyAxiom 4 Space Mission Live: India is on the cusp of writing history as its second astronaut begins his journey to space. IAF's Gp. Capt. Shubhanshu Shukla is geared up for the maiden launch to the Space Station for a 14-day mission to conduct first-of-its-kind experiments and studies designed by the Indian Space and Research Organisation (Isro).

The art of not giving a f*** about Donald TrumpJust as he had done in the case of India and Pakistan, Trump rushed to announce a ceasefire between Iran and Israel. This time, he kicked it off with a dramatic curtain-raiser: 'IT'S TIME FOR PEACE!' Two hours later, he disclosed the phased ceasefire 'deal'. What followed was a stream of posters featuring Trump in various poses, celebrating 'peace.'

Microsoft to fire more employees next week, said to be fourth biggest layoffMicrosoft is reportedly planning another round of job cuts. This time, it is reportedly targeting its Xbox division, as part of a broader effort to reorganise the company before the end of its financial year.

Why UK's lethal F-35 jet, worth $110 million, is stranded in Kerala for 10 daysSince June 14, a $110-million British F-35B stealth jet has remained grounded at Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram airport after an emergency landing. Ten days on, with failed repair attempts, the jet remains in the monsoon-drenched tarmac. What will it take to get the F-35 to get it airborne?

Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) System for Treatment of Severe Mitral RegurgitationThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

Meet the Axiom-4 crew going to space with India's Shubhanshu ShuklaThe Ax-4 mission will launch with astronauts from four countries, including India's Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, who begins his maiden space journey.

Shubman Gill's new India hurt by old flaws as England chase 371 in Leeds winEngland vs India, 1st Test: England rode on Ben Duckett's fourth innings 149 to script their second-highest successful chase in Test cricket history. India paid the price for their shoddy fielding and lower-order batting as Shubman Gill faced defeat in his captaincy debut in Leeds.

Love unrequited, woman techie tries to frame co-worker for Air India crashFuelled by a desire for revenge, Rene Joshilda allegedly embarked on a sophisticated campaign to ruin the man she was in unrequited love with, sending dozens of false bomb threats in his name. This included an e-mail claiming responsibility for the Air India Flight 171 crash.

News Menu, June 25: BJP's Emergency anniversary; India's heartbreaking Leeds lossIn today's News Menu: US President Donald Trump reprimands both Israel and Iran for violating the ceasefire agreement, the BJP observes the 50th anniversary of the 1975 Emergency as 'Samvidhan Hatya Diwas' and Shubman Gill-led India suffers a heartbreaking loss at Leeds in the first Test against England.

Zohran Mamdani, 33, wins Democratic mayoral primary after Andrew Cuomo concedesIndian-origin Zohran Mamdani, 33, has won the Democratic mayoral primary after rival and former Governor Andrew Cuomo conceded. Mamdani is the son of famous Indian-American filmmaker Mira Nair.

Norwegian man claims he was denied US entry over meme of bald JD VanceA 21-year-old tourist from Norway was barred from entering the US after immigration officials at Newark Airport found a meme of Vice President JD Vance on his phone. Mads Mikkelsen says he was deported the same day despite having no criminal record.

Situation beyond control: Diljit Dosanjh on Sardaar Ji 3 row over Pak actorActor Diljit Dosanjh, in a recent interview, opened up about the ongoing controversy surrounding 'Sardaar Ji 3'. The actor and the makers are facing the heat over casting Pakistani actor Hania Aamir amid India-Pakistan tensions.

Don't want regime change in Iran: Trump changes tune after ceasefireAfter flirting with the idea, US President Donald Trump said he doesn't want to see regime change in Iran amid its conflict with Israel because it would cause chaos.

Neeraj Chopra not happy despite winning gold in Ostrava Golden SpikeNeeraj Chopra might have won gold at the Ostrava Golden Spike, but was unhappy with his performance. Neeraj said that he needed to do better for his idol Jan Zelenzy.

India welcomes Israel-Iran truce: Ready to play our partNew Delhi said it remained 'deeply concerned' about the overall situation, but welcomed reports of a ceasefire between Iran and Israel. Though Trump announced the ceasefire between Israel and Iran, later he accused both sides of violating it.

Kolhapuris walk Prada ramp (without credit?), while also losing ground in IndiaCurrently a topic of discussion, thanks to Prada's Milan fashion show, Kolhapuri chappals face a bevy of challenges in their own country, with many insiders fearing that the actual craft might soon die out.

Bombay High Court relies on 10-year-old witness to uphold life term in murderThe Aurangabad bench of the Bombay High Court upheld the judgement of Jalna Sessions court which had given a life sentence to a man for brutally assaulting and killing his mother-in-law.

Who is 'Big Balls'? Teen DOGE engineer quits US governmentEdward Coristine, also known as "Big Balls," is a 19-year-old technologist who recently resigned from the US government's Department of Government Efficiency after a brief and controversial stint in the US government.

How India-born engineer in B-2 bomber project ended up as China spyIndia-born engineer Noshir Gowadia, who played a key role in developing the B-2 bomber's stealth propulsion system, was sentenced to 32 years in prison for leaking classified US military secrets to China and other countries. His disclosures reportedly helped China develop stealth cruise missile technology.

sports.headline: Neeraj Chopra not happy despite winning gold in Ostrava Golden SpikeNeeraj Chopra might have won gold at the Ostrava Golden Spike, but was unhappy with his performance. Neeraj said that he needed to do better for his idol Jan Zelenzy.

Club World Cup: Benfica stun Munich, Delap opens account in Chelsea's winBenfica caused a big upset after securing a 1-0 win over the reigning Bundesliga champions, Bayern Munich, in the FIFA Club World Cup. Meanwhile, Chelsea's latest addition, Liam Delap, scored his first goal for the club in their win over ES Tunis.

Gambhir backs pacers despite Leeds disaster: Building a battery for futureIndia's head coach Gautam Gambhir has called for patience with the young bowling attack after a heavy defeat in Leeds. He stressed the need to back inexperienced pacers to build a strong pace battery for the future.

India's Jasprit Bumrah plan won't change despite Leeds Test loss: GambhirENG vs IND: Despite India's defeat at Headingley, head coach Gautam Gambhir stood firm on their decision to manage Jasprit Bumrah's workload, confirming he will play only three Tests in the five-match series against England.

India lose Leeds Test despite 5 centuries: Anderson-Tendulkar series opener in statsHere's a look at top stats from India's crushing defeat against England in the first Test of the five-match series at Headingley, Leeds. England chased down 371 on Day 5 to hammer India by five wickets.

Olympique Lyon relegated due to financial irregularitiesOlympique Lyon has been relegated from Ligue 1 following a financial audit by the DNCG. The club plans to appeal, highlighting improved finances and recent player sales.

Win together, lose together: Gambhir won't blame individuals after Leeds lossEngland vs India: Head coach Gautam Gambhir acknowledged India the batting collapses and the ordinary catching in the first Test in Leeds. However, he said he won't point fingers at anyone in this new-look Indian side.

Shubman Gill honest after losing Leeds Test: Young team will improveShubman Gill's India fell short in the Leeds Test, but the young captain's composed, honest reflections after the loss showed maturity. With errors in fielding and collapses to address, the rebuilding process has officially begun.

Bazball strikes again: England stun India with another record 4th innings chaseEngland once again stunned India with a historic run chase in the first Test at Headingley, Leeds as they chased down 371 having five wickets in hand. It was for the second time that India were at the receiving end of England's batting masterclass.

Neeraj Chopra wins Gold in Ostrava Golden Spike event with best throw of 85.29mOstrava Golden Spike 2025: Two-time Olympic medalist continued his streak of finishing on the podium in competitions, winning gold in Czechia with a best effort of 85.29m. Neeraj finished ahead of Douw Smit of South Africa and Anderson Peters of Grenada.

India paid the price for their shoddy fielding and lower-order batting as Shubman Gill faced defeat in his captaincy debut in Leeds.

It was for the second time that India were at the receiving end of England's batting masterclass.

Neeraj finished ahead of Douw Smit of South Africa and Anderson Peters of Grenada.

India paid the price for their shoddy fielding and lower-order batting as Shubman Gill faced defeat in his captaincy debut in Leeds.

Bow down to Lord: Shardul Thakur memes go viral after double strike in Leeds TestShardul Thakur took two wickets in as many balls to revive India's fading hopes at Headingley on Day 5 of the first Test. England rode on Ben Duckett's 149 to go for the mammoth target of 371 in the series opener.

If Virat Kohli was playing in England, he would have scored runs: Sourav GangulyFormer India captain and BCCI President Sourav Ganguly feels Virat Kohli would've scored a lot of runs in the ongoing England tour, if he had continued playing Test cricket.

Mohammed Siraj fumes in frustration after Yashasvi Jaiswal drops 4th catchENG vs IND: Mohammed Siraj's fury said it all as Yashasvi Jaiswal dropped his fourth catch of the match—this time handing Ben Duckett a life on 97, compounding India's fielding woes on a tough Day 5 at Headingley.

Ben Duckett hits 4th innings century as England flaunt Bazball in LeedsEngland vs India: Ben Duckett smashed his sixth Test century to lead England's chase on Day 5 series opener. Duckett put India under immense pressure even as the visitors were trying to defend 371 at Headingley.

Tilak Varma flaunts love for Test cricket with century on County Championships debutCounty Championships 2025: Mumbai Indians batting star Tilak Varma hit a hundred on his debut for Hampshire in the prestigious first-class tournament in England. He played a patient knock, rescuing Hampshire against Essex on Tuesday.

Mohammed at one end, Krishna at the other: Shubman Gill's stump mic quipIndia Test captain Shubman Gill's quip for fast bowlers Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj from Day 5 of the first Test against England has been going viral on social media.

Headingley crowd boos India over repeated ball change plea on Day 5India's tough morning at Headingley turned tense when repeated ball-change appeals from Shubman Gill and Shardul Thakur were met with rejection — and a chorus of boos from the Leeds crowd during England's strong opening partnership.

Dilip Doshi dies: India, England players wear black armbands in Leeds tributeFormer Indian spinner Dilip Doshi passed away on June 23 at age 77. India and England players observed a minute's silence while wearing black armbands in a tribute to the spinner on Tuesday, June 24.

Tilak Varma flaunts love for Test cricket with century on County Championships debutCounty Championships 2025: Mumbai Indians batting star Tilak Varma hit a hundred on his debut for Hampshire in the prestigious first-class tournament in England. He played a patient knock, rescuing Hampshire against Essex on Tuesday.

Mohammed at one end, Krishna at the other: Shubman Gill's stump mic quipIndia Test captain Shubman Gill's quip for fast bowlers Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj from Day 5 of the first Test against England has been going viral on social media.

Dilip Doshi dies: India, England players wear black armbands in Leeds tributeFormer Indian spinner Dilip Doshi passed away on June 23 at age 77. India and England players observed a minute's silence while wearing black armbands in a tribute to the spinner on Tuesday, June 24.

Day 5 Highlights: England crush India by 5 wickets in epic chase at HeadingleyEngland (ENG) vs India (IND), 1st Test Day 5 Highlights: England chased down 371 in dominant fashion as Joe Root and Jamie Smith sealed a five-wicket win at Headingley, leaving India to rue poor fielding, wayward bowling, and a forgettable start to the Shubman Gill era.

Emma Raducanu thanks Wimbledon for blocking stalker's ticket purchaseBriton Emma Raducanu said she felt reassured about her safety after Wimbledon organisers prevented a man who had been stalking her from purchasing tickets for the Grand Slam, which begins on Monday.

Austrian GP preview: Verstappen seeks redemption, as McLaren look to extend leadThe 2025 Austrian Grand Prix takes place at Red Bull Ring with McLaren leading the championship. The race could reshape the title fight as Verstappen aims for a fifth win at his favourite track.

ICC punishes Rishabh Pant for showing dissent at umpire's decisionIndia's wicket-keeper-batter Rishabh Pant has been handed an official reprimand for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the Headingley Test.

Explained: Why are so many catches being dropped at Headingley?IND vs ENG 1st Test: India and England struggled with multiple dropped catches in the Leeds Test match. Former England captain Alastair Cook explained why both teams were dropping chances at slips.

Neeraj Chopra targets Ostrava win ahead of Tokyo World ChampionshipsAhead of his homecoming in Bengaluru with the Neeraj Chopra Classic on July 5, the Indian ace will look to make a mark at the Ostrava Golden Spike event as he enters as the favourite.

Let Pant be Pant: Rahul explains India keeper's method after twin centuriesIndia batter KL Rahul admitted on Monday that trying to understand Rishabh Pant's mindset is nearly impossible - and perhaps unnecessary. Pant became only the second wicketkeeper to hit two centuries in one Test match.

Leeds weather report: Rain set to play big part in thrilling final dayLeeds weather forecast: Rain is expected to impact the final day of the 1st Test between India and England at Headingley. Both teams aim to force a result despite tricky weather and pitch conditions.

Sunil Gavaskar reveals he wanted to do backstand after Rishabh Pant's hundredEngland vs India, Leeds Test: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar revealed that he was planning to do a backstand following Rishabh Pant's century against England in the first Test.

KL Rahul takes the lead: A Headingley statement years in the makingYears of silence, shifting roles, and unanswered questions found their reckoning at Headingley. KL Rahul, India's quiet constant, didn't just score a century - he reaffirmed himself as the pillar of a Test team rediscovering its rhythm.

India clear favourite going into Day 5: Stuart BroadIndia are favourites to win the first Test at Headingley after setting a 371-run target. The match's outcome hinges on India's ability to grab their catches in challenging conditions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
